dt: {bc}a hole, shaft, or cavity in the ground
{bc}a scooped-out place used for burning something (such as charcoal)
{bc}an area often sunken or depressed below the adjacent floor area: such as
{bc}an enclosure in which animals are made to fight each other
{bc}a space at the front of a theater for the orchestra
{bc}an area in a securities or commodities exchange in which members trade (such as stocks)
{bc}a place or situation of futility, misery, or degradation
{bc}a hollow or indentation especially in the surface of an organism: such as
{bc}a natural hollow in the surface of the body
{bc}one of the indented scars left in the skin by a pustular disease {bc}{sx|pockmark||}
{bc}a minute depression in the secondary wall of a plant cell functioning in the intercellular movement of water and dissolved material
{bc}any of the areas alongside an auto racecourse used for refueling and repairing the cars during a race

et: Middle English, from Old English {it}pytt{/it} (akin to Old High German {it}pfuzzi{/it} well), from Latin {it}puteus{/it} well, pit
shortdef: a hole, shaft, or cavity in the ground
a scooped-out place used for burning something (such as charcoal)

dt: {bc}to place, cast, bury, or store in a pit
{bc}to set (fighting birds, such as gamecocks) into or as if into a pit to fight
{bc}to preserve for a time an indentation made by pressure

shortdef: to place, cast, bury, or store in a pit
to make pits in; especially : to scar or mark with pits
to set (fighting birds, such as gamecocks) into or as if into a pit to fight
the stone of a drupaceous fruit
to remove the pit from (a fruit)

dt: river in northern California flowing southwest into the Sacramento River

shortdef: river in northern California flowing southwest into the Sacramento River

dt: {bc}a person who supervises the gaming tables in a casino

shortdef: a person who supervises the gaming tables in a casino

dt: {bc}a muscular, short-haired, stocky dog (such as an {d_link|American pit bull terrier|American pit bull terrier} or {d_link|American Staffordshire terrier|American Staffordshire terrier}) of any of several breeds or a hybrid with one or more of these breeds that was originally developed for fighting and is noted for strength, stamina, and tenacity

shortdef: a muscular, short-haired, stocky dog (such as an American pit bull terrier or American Staffordshire terrier) of any of several breeds or a hybrid with one or more of these breeds that was originally developed for fighting and is noted for strength, stamina, and tenacity

dt: {bc}a handsaw worked by two persons one of whom stands on or above the log being sawed into planks and the other below it usually in a pit

shortdef: a handsaw worked by two persons one of whom stands on or above the log being sawed into planks and the other below it usually in a pit

dt: {bc}a stop at the pits during an automobile race
{bc}a stop (as during a trip) for fuel, food, or rest or for use of a restroom
{bc}a temporary deviation from a direct or usual course

dt.t: a career {it}pit stop{/it} … where he worked temporarily in between TV jobs

dt: {bc}a place where a pit stop is or can be made

a stop (as during a trip) for fuel, food, or rest or for use of a restroom
